abort.single_instance_allowed: Only a single instance is allowed.

data.max_area_radius: Max radius in metres for simple AREA detection
data.devtracker_nothome_timeout: Timeout in seconds to consider a device as `Not Home`.
data.update_interval: How often in seconds to update sensor readings data
data.attenuation: Environment attenuation factor for distance calculation.
data.configured_devices: List of Bluetooth devices to specifically create tracking entities for.
data.smoothing_samples: How many samples to use for smoothing distance readings.

data_description.max_area_radius: In the simple `AREA` feature, a device will be marked as being in the AREA of it's closest receiver, if inside this radius. If you set it small, devices will go to `unknown` between receivers, but if large devices will always appear as in their closest Area.
data_description.devtracker_nothome_timeout: How quickly to mark device_tracker entities as `not_home` after we stop seeing advertisements. 30 seconds or more is probably good.
data_description.update_interval: Distance readings indicating approaches will still trigger immediately, but increasing distances will be rate limited by this to reduce how much your database grows.
data_description.smoothing_samples: How many samples to average distance smoothing. Bigger numbers make for slower distance increases. 10 or 20 seems good.

dump_devices.name: Dump Devices
dump_devices.description: Returns the internal data structure, optionally limited to the given address(es). Includes the rssi and other info from each scanner

addresses.name: Addresses
addresses.description: An optional space-separated list of MAC addresses to return info on. If blank get all addresses.
